CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The J sc calculated from integration of the EQE with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum roughly agreed with the J sc obtained from the J-V measurements.

Let's think step by step.

1. J sc: The "J sc" in the paragraph refers to the Joint Solar Cell parameter, which is a material property related to the photovoltaic performance of a solar cell. It is the short-circuit current density at the standard AM 1.5G solar spectrum.

Therefore, "J sc" is the Material Name entity in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.
Material Name: J sc (Joint Solar Cell parameter)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| J sc (Joint Solar Cell parameter) |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The J sc calculated from integration of the EQE with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum roughly agreed with the J sc obtained from the J-V measurements.

Let's think step by step.

1. J sc: The J sc is a photocurrent density, which is a measure of the photovoltaic response of a material or device under illumination. It is typically measured in A/cm² or mA/cm².
2. EQE: The abbreviation EQE stands for External Quantum Efficiency. It is a measure of the efficiency of a photovoltaic device in converting light energy into electrical energy before accounting for losses in the electrical system. It is typically expressed as a percentage.
3. AM 1.5G: AM 1.5G is a standard reference spectrum used in photovoltaics to measure the performance of solar cells. It represents the spectral distribution of sunlight reaching the Earth's surface at an angle of incidence of 45 degrees under standard test conditions.
4. J-V measurements: J-V measurements refer to the measurement of the current-voltage characteristics of a photovoltaic device. These measurements provide important information about the performance of the device, including its open-circuit voltage (Voc), short-circuit current (Isc), and maximum power output (Pmax).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. J sc: The J sc is a material property that represents the photocurrent density of a material or device under illumination. It is typically measured in A/cm² or mA/cm².
2. External quantum efficiency (EQE): EQE is a material property that represents the efficiency of a photovoltaic device in converting light energy into electrical energy before accounting for losses in the electrical system. It is typically expressed as a percentage.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| J sc (photocurrent density) |
| External quantum efficiency (EQE) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The J sc calculated from integration of the EQE with an AM 1.5G reference spectrum roughly agreed with the J sc obtained from the J-V measurements.

Let's think step by step.

1. J sc: The J sc is a photovoltaic property value, specifically the junction box short-circuit current density. It is the current density that flows through a solar cell when it is short-circuited.
2. EQE: The EQE (External Quantum Efficiency) is another photovoltaic property value, which represents the fraction of incident photons that are converted into electrical current.
3. AM 1.5G reference spectrum: This is a standard solar spectrum used as a reference for measuring the performance of solar cells. It is a property value in the sense that it is a well-defined and widely used reference for comparing the efficiency of different solar cells.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. J sc: The J sc is a material property value, specifically the short-circuit current density of a solar cell.
2. EQE: The EQE is another material property value, representing the external quantum efficiency of a solar cell.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| J sc (short-circuit current density of a solar cell) |
| EQE (external quantum efficiency of a solar cell) |
